title: Signal Report — Holiday Flagship Timing and Tests
highlights: High‑value window: Nov 12 through Cyber Week — move spend and inventory earlier to reach shifting demand.
Test targets: design to detect 10–15% foot‑traffic lift for 10–14 day pop‑ups; capture emails and 14‑day conversion.
Measurement: instrument weekly share‑of‑sales to detect a 3–6 percentage‑point early‑deal share change versus last year.
executive_summary: Front-load flagship campaigns into the pre‑Thanksgiving week (starting Nov 12) and measure weekly share‑of‑sales and traffic against last‑year baselines to capture shoppers moving earlier this season [^5][^4]. Design pop‑up and parade‑timed activation tests to detect 10–15% foot‑traffic uplift versus baseline over a 10–14 day window, and capture emails and 14‑day conversion to translate visits into sales signals [^3][^6]. In the next 30 days, operations, merchandising and analytics must lock phased inventory allocations, instrument store and site traffic and conversion, and stand up a 10–14 day pop‑up pilot so teams can track early‑deal share and target a 3–6 percentage‑point increase versus last year for quick reallocation decisions [^5][^4].
top_operator_moves: Shift flagship campaigns and inventory into a phased program starting Nov 12; measure weekly share‑of‑sales and traffic versus last year.
Pilot a 10–14 day co‑branded pop‑up in a high‑footfall urban location; capture emails and 14‑day conversion for direct attribution.
Run an eight‑week dynamic markdown pilot on a test set of SKUs across flagships and e‑comm; compare discount depth, sell‑through and margin to control SKUs.
